haiku: Hold it to your ear / The ocean trapped inside speaks / Waves from far away
Something's off with him / Trust your gut when it warns you / Not all smiles are kind
A blade of sunlight / Cuts the edge of the moment / Then nothing remains
Green carpet spreads wide / Beneath bare feet cool and soft / Earth's simplest pleasure
Gift of ancient kings / Incense from another time / Sacred smoke rises
Pieces stitched to whole / Warmth made from scraps of other things / History in fabric
Bodies clash and strain / The ball moves through pure will / Mud and glory mixed
From one thought to next / Seamlessly the bridge connects / Conversation flows
Thread waits in still loops / Patient circles hold their breath / Until hands give motion
The absence of color / Snow and bone and clean sheets share / Purity in hue
